translation: uniżony, skrajny [formal; terrible and without hope; without any pride or respect for yourself]
skracać [to make a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing details and information that is not important]
sentence: She has been asked to abridge the movie for television.

translation: ostry, dotkliwy [very serious or severe; intelligent and quick to notice and understand things]
sentence: The problem of poverty is particularly acute in rural areas.

translation: wyniszczanie, ścieranie [also metaphorically; gradually making something weaker and destroying it, especially the strength or confidence of an enemy by repeatedly attacking it; a reduction in the number of people who work for an organization that is achieved by not replacing those people who leave]
sentence: Most of the job losses will come through attrition.
To his parents' chagrin, he had no intention of becoming a lawyer.
A man in the street was selling bags of roast chestnuts.

translation: ciasto (przed upieczeniem) [a thick mixture of flour and liquid used to make foods such as bread or pastry]
sentence: She kneaded the dough and left it to rise.

translation: ćwiczenie utrwalające [a teaching method in which students repeat something several times to help them learn it]
sentence: We do lots of drills to practise pronunciation.

translation: cumować [to tie a boat so that it stays in the same place]
sentence: We moored the boat to a large tree root.
Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice.

translation: niedorzeczny, absurdalny [formal; completely unreasonable and ridiculous; not to be believed]
sentence: It was a preposterous idea, and no one took it seriously.

translation: upominać, karcić [formal; to speak angrily to someone because you disapprove of what they have said or done]
sentence: I was rebuked by my manager for being late.

translation: dochód [the income that a government or company receives regularly]
sentence: Taxes provide most of the government's revenue.

translation: skrawek, kawałek [a small piece of something or a small amount of information]
sentence: I've read every scrap of information I can find on the subject.

translation: płytka, dachówka [a thin, usually square or rectangular piece of baked clay, plastic, etc. used for covering roofs, floors, walls, etc.]
sentence: We lost a few tiles in the storm.
